ygData.subject: RE: Thread was closed
ygData.msgSnippet: Believe me I have tried the non-public way of getting attention on these issues.  Before I made the post mentioned below I sent GZ and Brad a similiar list of
ygData.messageBody:
Believe me I have tried the non-public way of getting attention on these
issues. Before I made the post mentioned below I sent GZ and Brad a
similiar list of questions several times spaced out over 2 months. With
absolutely no response. That is what lead to the public display of the
issues. Besides the Bard threads (for the most part) are much more reasoned
then the Necro or Druid threads :)

Rokenn


>From: "Joshua R. Moore" <josh@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Thread was closed
>Date: Wed, 23 Feb 2000 10:17:45 -0500
>
>I wasn't trying to be snide or anything, I was jsut wondering if there were
>a better way to do this.
>I humbly apologize
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Rokenn Swiftsong [mailto:rokenn@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, February 23, 2000 10:10 AM
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Thread was closed
>
>
>From: "Rokenn Swiftsong" <rokenn@...>
>
>Bumping is the only way to get their attention. This has been proven by
>positive feedback from Abashi. The ONLY reason we even got a full issue of
>the Arch-Magi Column devoted to Bards was due to a post I made that was
>bumped over 400 times. Verant lives by the squeaky wheel philosophy it
>seems...
>
>Rokenn
>
>
> >From: "Joshua R. Moore" <josh@...>
> >Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
> >To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
> >Subject: RE: [eqbards] Thread was closed
> >Date: Wed, 23 Feb 2000 09:35:52 -0500
> >
> >You folks do know that annoying them to death is not likely to work very
> >well, right?=)
> >
> >Not saying I disagree with you, but perhaps we need to go about this
> >another
> >way than annoying the board admins with bumping
> >
> >-----Original Message-----
